triples.name: Clock synchronization
triples.relevance: LSL's core innovation is a software-based clock synchronization approach for distributed systems without hardware-mediated solutions.

triples.name: Data stream
triples.relevance: LSL manages and synchronizes multiple continuous data streams from various instruments and sensors.

triples.name: Local area network
triples.relevance: LSL synchronizes data across a common LAN with support for network delays and jitter compensation.

triples.name: Brainâ€“computer interface
triples.relevance: LSL is deployed in brain-computer interface applications for real-time data acquisition and synchronization.

triples.name: Neurophysiology
triples.relevance: LSL was built from the ground up for neurophysiological applications and multimodal human neurobehavioral recording.

triples.name: Real-time computing
triples.relevance: LSL enables millisecond-precise real-time data recording with guaranteed response times for continuous monitoring.

triples.name: Jitter
triples.relevance: LSL introduces jitter compensation as a novel technique to handle network timing variations and ensure reliable synchronization.

triples.name: Electroencephalography
triples.relevance: LSL supports synchronized recording from EEG devices as part of its neurophysiological data acquisition capabilities.

triples.name: Network Time Protocol
triples.relevance: LSL employs time synchronization concepts similar to NTP but with per-sample timestamps and lower latency requirements.

triples.name: Data acquisition
triples.relevance: LSL provides a unified framework for synchronized data acquisition across over 150 different instrument classes.
